title: 7 bedroom terraced house for rent
description: Located on Upper Grosvenor Street in Mayfair, sits this 8,958 sq ft. historic home dating back to 1727, with seven bedrooms, eight bathrooms, three generously sized reception areas and an ample private garden. The property also features its original three-bay brick façade, period windows and a 19th-century portico. <PARA> After a fire to the building in 1834, a significant rebuild took place in the early 1920s, restoring the property back to its original Georgian style. <PARA> Further restoration was made to the house in 1988 by Christopher Vane Percy, with nods to the architectural detailing such as the decorative architraves, door hardware, wall panelling and ceiling scones to further speak to the building's history. <PARA> The house has since been fully modernized, with new fixtures and fittings to all bathrooms and kitchens, as well as a high-spec security system throughout.

The house has been recently refurbished to a high standard. <PARA> There is a total of four reception rooms throughout the home creating plenty of space for the whole family. The spacious open plan kitchen and dining room is perfect for entertaining. The kitchen is fully integrated with a large central island and an eye-level oven. The kitchen flows into the conservatory, which has large double doors leading to the lovely patio garden, which has ample room for outdoor dining. There is also a formal reception room on the first floor, with access to a balcony, and a TV room on the lower ground floor. <PARA> The house has five well-proportioned bedrooms, all with storage space. The principal bedroom is situated on the second floor and benefits from a spacious dressing room and a beautiful en suite bathroom. <PARA> The house is beautifully presented throughout with a neutral finish and tasteful furnishings. The house also benefits from a gym on the lower ground floor and a study on the first floor. <PARA> Approximately 323 sq m (3,479 sq ft). <PARA> EPC: D <PARA> Available to rent furnished or unfurnished through Knight Frank South Kensington. <PARA> Neville Street is a classic South Kensington street located between Old Brompton Road and Fulham Road and offers convenient access to the many excellent shops and eateries in South Kensington and Chelsea.
